Misty,
I opened an esnips account what do you do to get the files to the g=
roup?
 
bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabe=
a@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 10:06:21 -0800Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: =
**Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**





Thanks Bruce. My w=
ish is that we had unlimited posting/filing space. But til then we will hav=
e to make do with what we have. Try the esnips thing out several of us are =
already over there forming our lil community for file sharing. With 50 gigs=
 you can pretty much post in whatever format you like which is what we do. =
Some files are just too large to post here or too many of them to post all =
at once so we just use that instead.
 
Plus its easy to link up with others=
 so that they get notifications you have uploaded a new file. I think for n=
ow its a great way to expand our group and possibly even reach more people =
who havent joined here or even heard of the things we do. It also keeps a h=
it count for how many people visit your folders so you can see what people =
are listening to. And it allows comments so that visitors can give feedback=
 if they wish.
 
Mistybruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> =
wrote:


Misty, Your wish is my command. I will convert to mp3from now on. =
bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabea@yahoo.=
comDate: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 17:13:53 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special No=
tice Regaurding Your Group Membership**


Yep I agree with a few files ther=
e is some loss in conversion. Thats why I sent out that program because it =
has next to no loss in the conversion. But again I will say I would rather =
post 1 meg of files than take up the entire groups space by posting 15 megs=
 of files. When I want to share more complete audio I just use my esnips.co=
m account to do that. It is just as easy for people to click on my esnips h=
otlink in a notification post as it is to click on the files link to the le=
ft.You are right we just have to manage ourselves better.Misty--- In EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > =
I post in wav. format I believe when you convert the file from wav to mp3.>=
 certain aspects of the file are lost. If an mp3. file is a tenth of the si=
ze of> a wav. file where does the other 9/10's go.> > If it is compressed t=
hen it definitely loses quality. > I think every nuance in a box file is cr=
ucial for the > correct interpretation of the file, sometimes the a word cr=
eated by the entity is not only> comprised of radio fragment but also stati=
c noise mixed with the fragments of radio vocal> to form the message the en=
tity wishes to leave. I don't know the technical aspects of the file > chan=
ge but I think it's common sense that when you try to pour a gallon of wate=
r into a shot glass> all you wind up with is a shot glass full of water the=
 rest is spilled and lost.> > I keep my files posted for 5 or less days, ju=
st long enough for anyone that wants to listen can.> If your going to leave=
 your files posted indefinitely and keep adding to the folder then of cours=
e it will> put pressure on the storage space.> > As far as posting a notice=
 for every file, some of us may wish to listen from their e-mail or not > h=
ave to go to the file section to listen, That's probably why that option is=
 given.> If I didn't like the notices cluttering up my e-mail in box you ca=
n change that feature in the group> membership options. So if anyone does n=
ot want that feature they can turn it off and only read posts on the group.=
> > It's not the lack of space is the mismanagement of it by all of us. > w=
hen I change my files from wav. to mp3 I hear a distinct difference, do it =
in an audio editor and you can visually see the difference.> > Bruce> Bruce=
 Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: warrior18eii@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 05:05:3=
7 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Me=
mbership**> > > > > > > That's a great idea Steve and it was mentioned befo=
re but either no one noticed Misty's post or it was ignored. It would be a =
shame though if people start loosing files because they are not paying atte=
ntion to the owners instructions.Regards,Frank R.> ----- Original Message -=
---From: Steve Hultay <urkel23@...>To: EVP-ITC@...: Wednesday, January 30, =
2008 6:06:23 AMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Grou=
p Membership**> > Misty,I have and idea. One solution is to post Mp3 files =
instead of Wav. files or any other format. It seems like the Mp3's sound th=
e same and are only 1/10th of the size. I think that would probably clear u=
p 90 percent of the board right there. If i actually have more than a coupl=
e files from here on out, i will be attaching them to an e-mail and not the=
 board to save space here. And also, if people do post files maybe we can a=
ll just have one post that says we have uploaded files to our folder instea=
d of 30 audio announcements in a row that just seems to waste a lot of e-ma=
il space in the individual e-mails. And it also pushes the current topic on=
 the board to another page and is lost for those who wanted to share. Just =
my thoughts on helping the subject. I know we are all excited, but misty is=
 right. I went to add a file the other day and the group was at 93 percent =
capacity, so it won't be long before we run out of space.-Steve H.--- In EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@ ...> wrote:>> Just a little f=
riendly reminder that you all need to organize your > files better in the f=
iles area. Space is limited here and you are all > nearing the 100% mark so=
 try to keep your section under 5 megs. If > you need more space use www.es=
nips.com and you can store 50 gigs to > share with the group or public.> > =
I think it is great you guys have so much to share I just wish that > our y=
ahoo group wasnt so limited on space (and that I wasnt so > limited on time=
). But I have found a way around it. If just a few > people signed up and s=
hared using esnips they can invite others to > visit thier files and once t=
hey do they also get 50 gigs of free > space for audio pictures or video or=
 whatever you want to post.> > I was considering setting up one "group" acc=
ount to start with and > inviting all members who post files to join it and=
 be able to post to > the account. It will automatically notify everyone th=
ats a member > when a file is added to it just like the yahoo group does. I=
t also > allows you to share with the public or privately if you so choose.=
 > You can even allow your friends to post to your account if you wish.> > =
This group has grown and expanded and we just need to make a few > changes =
to how we do things to keep it running more smoothly for the > future. I am=
 hoping that you all will help me in this endeavor. I > know many of you ha=
ve already adapted the idea to help us organize > and maintain the group.> =
> I want you to keep sharing and to be able to share more! > > So please or=
ganize and not post stray files that are targets for > deletion once the qu=
e is 100% full. And for your own sake, if no one > elses, be respectful to =
each other.> > MD>> > Be a better friend, newshound, and know-it-all with Y=
ahoo! Mobile. Try it now. > > > > > > > > _________________________________=
